oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Whatâ€™s New in Our Knowledge of the Lower Digestive Tract?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Whitlock, Robert H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: abomasal ulcer
ulceration
hemorrhage
anemia
peritonitis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There are four syndromes associated with abomasal ulcers (1). The first type is that of slight ulceration or erosion with only mild or no clinical signs. The second syndrome is that of marked hemorrhage or anemia. The third syndrome is that of abomasal perforation with acute circumscribed peritonitis. The causative factors related to cecal torsion are very similar to those of abomasal displacement.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1971; 38-43
